projectGridLines.stationName: IUDX Program Unit, Indian Institute of science - Data Kaveri,Bengaluru
projectGridLines.title: Secure Enclaves
projectGridLines.description:
Secure enclaves are trusted execution environments that help code and data loaded in them to be protected in terms of integrity and confidentiality. Data/code integrity prevents unauthorized entities from altering or modifying the data/code, while data confidentiality

prevents unauthorized from reading the data variables. Real-world secure enclave execution environments include Intel SGX, ARM TrustZone, and AWS Nitro Enclaves. This project involves optimized implementation of machine learning algorithms on secure

enclaves.


Skill sets:

An ideal student for this project should be passionate about system engineering, having expertise in C++/Python/Linux environment.


Expected learning:

This project gives an opportunity to the student to gain hands-on experience on important privacy-preserving frameworks, while working closely with industry experts.


Specific courses required for project execution:

Programming, Data Science, Data Analytics

projectGridLines.stationName: IUDX Program Unit, Indian Institute of science - Data Kaveri,Bengaluru
projectGridLines.title: Secure Multi-Party Computation
projectGridLines.description:
Secure Multi-Party Computation (SMPC) is a subfield of cryptography that allows multiple parties to jointly compute a function over their inputs, while keeping those inputs private. The basic input-privacy property of a SMPC protocol ensures that no information about the private

data held by the parties can be inferred from the messages exchanged during the execution of the protocol (the only information that can be inferred about the private data is whatever could be inferred from seeing the output of the function alone).

- This project involves optimized implementation of machine learning algorithms and electronic double-auction algorithms using SMPC protocols.


Skill sets:

An ideal student for this project should be an expert in C++ having experience in handling large scale projects. Knowledge and interest in cryptography protocols is an advantage.


Expected learning:

This project provides an opportunity for publication of technical papers that may help students get admission to top international institutes for higher studies.


Specific courses required for project execution:

Programming, Data Science, Data Analytics

projectGridLines.stationName: IUDX Program Unit, Indian Institute of science - Data Kaveri,Bengaluru
projectGridLines.title: Differential Privacy
projectGridLines.description:
Description:

Differential Privacy is a formal mathematical framework for providing user privacy when sharing aggregate statistics about a group of individuals. This is achieved by making small changes to the released aggregate statistics, which cannot be used to infer much about any individual. Differential privacy has been widely adopted by various organizations such as Google, Microsoft, Apple, and US Census Bureau for sharing information.


Skill sets:

An ideal student for this project should be highly skilled in probability/statistics and Python, while being passionate about research.


Expected learning:

This project provides an opportunity for publication of technical papers (in collaboration with IISc professors) that may help students get admission to top international institutes for higher studies.


Specific courses required for project execution:

Programming, Data Science, Data Analytics
